title: One free agent each NFL team should sign: We found 32 perfect fits

title: Sources: Cowboys to franchise-tag WR Pickens
content: The Cowboys will do what has been expected on Friday, placing the franchise tag on receiver George Pickens to secure his rights at least through 2026, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Last year for Gillispie at Tarleton St.
content: Tarleton State is expected to formally announce this morning that men's basketball coach Billy Gillispie will not return next year.

content: Former Alabama quarterback Ty Simpson said Friday at the NFL's scouting combine that he's prepared to show NFL talent evaluators that he is a "franchise quarterback.''

title: QB Mendoza would love Raiders' Brady as mentor
content: Quarterback Fernando Mendoza, the presumptive top pick in April's NFL draft, met with the Raiders at the combine Friday and loves the idea of having seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady as a potential mentor.

title: Sources: Trump, college leaders to meet March 6
content: Conference commissioners are expected to join sports celebrities and dignitaries on March 6 in a roundtable discussion with President Donald Trump about the future of college athletics, sources said.

title: Knueppel sets rookie 3-pt. record -- in 59 games

title: Hawks plan Magic City night to honor 'institution'

content: The Buffalo Bills are re-signing special teams player and safety Sam Franklin Jr. to a three-year deal, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

content: ESPN's Premier League Power Rankings return to look at all 20 teams: Chelsea are up, Liverpool are down, and Crystal Palace are on fire.

content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Champions League round of 16 predictions: Real Madrid over Man City?
content: The path to the Champions League final is now mapped out, but who do we think makes it all the way to Budapest? Mark Ogden makes his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea, PSG watch Genk trio
content: Scouts from clubs including Chelsea, Manchester City, Man United and Paris Saint-Germain watched three Racing Genk stars play. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Man's CPR On Moving Vehicle Fails To Save Father In Madhya Pradesh
content: In the middle of a traffic jam, on the back of a rattling loader vehicle, a son knelt beside his father, pressing down on his chest again and again, his voice breaking with every plea "Papa... open your eyes. Papa, please open your eyes."

title: Will Clean Chit To Arvind Kejriwal Spark AAP Resurgence? What Experts Said
content: The AAP governed Delhi for over 10 years and was seen as very popular until the liquor policy charges and the 'Sheesh Mahal' controversy.

title: Congress Leader's Unique Headstand Protest Over "False" Gunfire Case
content: Bhopal witnessed a dramatic spectacle on the 10th day of the state Assembly's Budget Session as Congress MLA from Sheopur, Babu Jandel, performed Shirshasana or a headstand in protest against an FIR filed against him.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Many Firsts In India's New Defence Acquisition Policy
content: If implemented in both letter and spirit, the next decade could witness measurable progress in India's ability to design, produce, and sustain its own defence systems-reducing import dependence and strengthening India's strategic autonomy.

title: Arvind Kejriwal: A Political Comeback That Congress Didn't See Coming
content: Arvind Kejriwal, the country's first sitting chief minister to be arrested while in office, struggled to contain his emotions after being cleared of all charges in the excise policy case that had defined his political life for nearly two years.

title: O Panneerselvam's Political Pivot: Here's How He Landed In DMK
content: Just three days ago, after paying homage to former J Jayalalithaa on her birth anniversary, the ousted AIADMK coordinator O Panneerselvam declared he would not join any political party or launch one. Cut to Friday morning, he crossed over to the DMK.

title: With Canada Home To 29 Lakh Overseas Indians, Carney's India Reset
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit to India from February 27 to March 2, 2026, arrives at a time when political, economic, and strategic issues dominate public discussion.

title: "We Have Won": Manish Sisodia's Call To Wife While She Was Mid-Prayer
content: She was mid-prayer, when Manish Sisodia called to say "hum jeet gaye hain (We have won)".This, however, put Seema Sisodia, Manish's wife, in a Hamlettian dilemma: should she finish her prayers or should she rejoice. She chose the former.

title: New York Police Arrest Man After Officers Were Pelted During Snowball Fight
content: A social media content creator was arrested Thursday after New York City police said he was one of a number of people who pelted officers with snow and ice during a massive snowball fight in Washington Square Park this week.

title: What Anna Hazare Said On Arvind Kejriwal's Discharge In Excise Case
content: Social activist Anna Hazare on Friday welcomed the discharge of AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy case, saying the court's verdict must be accepted as judiciary is supreme.

title: Violence Against Women 'A Global Emergency': United Nations
content: The UN rights chief on Friday decried mounting threats to women's rights worldwide, highlighting rampant femicide and horrific abuse exposed in cases like that of US sex offender Jefferey Epstein.

title: US Sympathies Shift To Palestinians From Israelis For First Time, Poll Finds
content: Americans for the first time sympathize more with Palestinians than Israelis in their conflict, according to a Gallup poll released Friday, after the devastating Gaza war.

title: Trump Administration Is Detaining, Questioning Refugees Already Admitted To The US
content: Overturning years of precedent, immigration authorities have arrested or questioned dozens of refugees in Minnesota, attorneys and advocates say, with more detentions likely to come nationwide.

title: US Military Used Laser To Take Down Border Protection Drone, Lawmakers Say
content: The U.S. military used a laser Thursday to shoot down a "seemingly threatening" drone flying near the U.S.-Mexico border. It turned out the drone belonged to Customs and Border Protection, lawmakers said.

title: Dancing Robots Bring Support, Company To Barcelona Elderly
content: Barcelona resident Irene Veglison had not danced for more than two decades until a robot moved into her home three months ago.

title: Video: Air Force Showcases "Longest Ever Kill In Military History" By S-400
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has released a video showing the S400 Sudarshan longrange air defence missile system in action.

title: SIR Officials Mistakenly Reach Odisha, Thrashed By Villagers, 72 Arrested
content: Police have arrested 72 persons in connection with the alleged assault on two officials from West Bengal deployed for the Special Intensive Revision exercise, who entered Odisha's Balasore district by mistake.

title: India-US Trade Deal May Be 'Rebalanced' Amid Tariff Uncertainty: Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that India would go in for a 'rebalancing' of the proposed trade agreement with the United States, if required, to protect its interests after the US Supreme Court's verdict on tariffs.

title: 3 Of Family Die By Suicide, 3-Page Note Reveals Credit Card Fraud
content: Days after a mass suicide shocked Surat, the man accused of pushing the Khetan family to the brink has been caught in Delhi.

title: Chellanam reeling under acute drinking water crisis
content: According to civic representatives, aging pipelines and lack of proper maintenance by the KWA has resulted in the crisis

title: FIR against Mallikarjun Mutya challenged in High Court
content: Mahal Roja Mutt head approaches court seeking to get the FIR registered against him quashed; matter likely to come up on Monday

title: Andhra Pradesh, Telangana plan joint arrangements for Godavari Pushkarams
content: A.P. Endowments Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy holds discussions with Telangana Dy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka over the coordinated efforts during the latter's visit to A.P. Assembly

title: Vizhinjam ‚Äúseafood poisoning‚Äù: searching for marine algal toxins in fish becoming an onerous task, say officials
content: Food Safety officials point out that only the forensic report on the viscera samples of those who died of ‚Äúseafood poisoning‚Äù alone can provide clarity. However, no stool or blood samples seem to have been collected from the deceased

title: Bangalore University decides to extend village adoption to all its departments
content: There are about 42 departments in Bangalore University, including Kannada, English, and performing arts; the university has asked all these departments to adopt at least two villages.

title: Chief Minister Pinarayi¬†Vijayan will lead LDF‚Äôs Assembly poll campaign in Kerala, confirms CPI(M) PB
content: CPI(M) will announce its candidates within a week, says general secretary M.A. Baby. Party will decide on Chief Ministerial candidate only after the LDF emerges victorious

title: NCERT Class VIII textbook: Kerala Minister welcomes SC intervention over references to ‚Äòcorruption‚Äô in judiciary
content: V. Sivankutty demands that an independent expert committee probe all revisions and deletions in all NCERT textbooks in recent times

title: Kumbalanghi panchayat Budget lays emphasis on housing project
content: The Budget also announced a ‚ÄòClean Kumbalanghi-Green Kumbalanghi‚Äô project in collaboration with the Kochi Corporation and Clean Kerala company

title: NSS denies permission for security checks at Mannam Samadhi ahead of Vice-President‚Äôs visit
content: Objection pertains solely to inspections at the Samadhi Mandapam involving police dogs, say NSS sources

title: Govt. spending ‚Çπ13,722 crore to provide free electricity to farmers, says Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar
content: The Minister also says that 1.10 lakh agricultural electricity connections have been sanctioned so far to support the farming community

title: JD(S) will stay in NDA, asserts Deve Gowda
content: I have seen several govts. and the current Congress govt. is the worst I have seen in my life, the former PM says at a JD(S) rally in Vijayapura

content: In this episode of Tamil Nadu Elections with The Hindu, we decode OPS‚Äôs journey, from ‚ÄúMr. Loyal‚Äù and the face of the 2017 Dharma Yudham, to expulsion from the AIADMK, a brief alignment with the BJP, and finally his entry into the DMK.

content: ‚ÄòAspire 2026‚Äô Job Fair sees 200 placements; MoU with Infosys to offer 16-week free Internship for Engineering students

title: Revenue officials seal illegal resort in Munnar
content: It was alleged that the resort was operating without a no objection certificate from the Revenue department

title: Technical education sees strong revival in Kerala
content: Factors driving this trend include recent curriculum reforms aimed at aligning education with industry needs and enhancing practical learning opportunities, as the state invests in over 500 technology business incubators and a Digital Workforce Management System to connect job seekers with employers.

title: Two more Youth Congress workers arrested in AI Summit ‚Äòshirtless‚Äô protest case
content: The accused, identified as Girdhar and Kuber Meena, take the total number of arrests in the case to 14, the officer said

title: Naidu, Jagan condole demise of Chilkur Balaji temple head priest Soundararajan
content: Naidu describes his spiritual services as exemplary and says his passing is an irreparable loss to the spiritual community

title: Nearly 3,984 children rescued in six months: NCPCR representative
content: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) in collaboration with the District Administration of Kodagu organised a district-level conference in Madikeri to deliberate on key child rights issues

title: State-level inauguration of Kerala Climate Resilient Agri-Value Chain Modernisation (KERA) at Cherthala on March 2
content: A flagship initiative of Kerala government, the ‚Çπ2,365-crore project is aimed at addressing the challenges posed by climate change and fragmented markets and dwindling farmer incomes

title: Kollam Corporation Budget presented; focus on tourism, transformative development projects
content: Budget allocates ‚Çπ100 crore for transforming Kollam into a top-tier tourist destination. It also proposes demolition of existing Chinnakada flyover to make way for a modern elevated flyover stretching from Kollam railway station to taluk office in order to alleviate congestion in the heart of the city

title: Tirumala laddu issue continues to rock Legislative Council
content: Government ready to discuss the issue for three days if necessary, but the YSRCP members are blocking debate out of fear that facts will emerge, says Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu

title: Why youth of North Karnataka rely heavily on govt. jobs?
content: Uneven growth and an inadequate educational ecosystem leave government jobs as the only ladder of mobility in backward regions

title: Keralam to become India‚Äôs first dumpsite-free State in two years, says Minister
content: Waste heaps at 25 of the 59 dumpsites in the State have already been cleared, reclaiming 96 acres, while biomining is under way at the remaining 34 sites, says M.B. Rajesh

title: Congress using guarantees to deflect attention away from failure to develop State, says Kumaraswamy
content: Ministers are just repeating that they have kept their promises on guarantees as an excuse for not taking up any development, according to Union Minister who addresses rally in Vijayapura to celebrate 25 years of founding of party

title: Watch: Canada PM Mark Carney lands in Mumbai
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney arrives in Mumbai for a four-day visit to India, aimed at strengthening bilateral ties, boosting trade and investment, and resetting relations after recent diplomatic tensions.

title: Naidu unveils ambitious agriculture and housing roadmap for A.P.
content: Government is promoting large-scale farm mechanisation and introducing AI-based agronomist services to improve productivity and reduce cultivation costs, aims to complete 10.63 lakh houses this year, says Chief Minister in the Assembly

title: Four policemen, including SI, suspended after custodial assault leaves accused with severe ailment
content: The group had purportedly subjected two accused in a vehicle theft case to brutal assault while in custody

title: Sajjanar inspects H-CITI steel flyover work at Banjara Hills
content: Project aims to establish a signal-free road network in the city, particularly around KBR Park: Sajjanar

title: Notify State policy on prevention of non-communicable diseases:  Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights
content: Recommendations are the outcome of five State-level consultations held with children affected by non-communicable diseases and other stakeholders last year

title: Kudumbashree initiative aims to boost women‚Äôs income
content: Kudumbashree products to hit mainstream retail shelves across the State. Income of women in Kerala set for major surge, says Minister M.B. Rajesh.

title: Talks to begin today but AICC high command split between DMK and TVK
content: The induction of former AIADMK leader, O. Panneerselvam into the DMK would mean that the space for ‚Äúincreased number of seats‚Äù for the Congress appears grim, further complicating the seat sharing process

title: Maharashtra Women‚Äôs Commission begins work on menstrual leave framework
content: Commission‚Äôs chairperson says menstrual leave ‚Äúis associated with women‚Äôs dignity, the availability of resources, (and) the equality she should enjoy‚Äù

title: Bihar ranks high in adoption of ‚ÄòMeri Panchayat‚Äô app with over 3.22 lakh users
content: Uttar Pradesh holds first place with 11.63 lakh downloads; information related to a panchayat such as welfare schemes, funds, development works & weather forecasts available on the NIC-developed app

title: Aim is to see Andhra University among top 10  institutions nationally, says HRD Minister Lokesh
content: Promising to celebrate the university‚Äôs centenary on a grand scale, he asserts that its ranking improved after the coalition government came to power, and vows action against those responsible for irregularities in the institution soon

title: Open Day at Raman Research Institute on February 28
content: It will be organised by the RRI, with students and staff across the institute putting together engaging programmes featuring experiments, scientific demonstrations, and a range of exciting activities

title: Animal husbandry backbone of rural economy, says Governor
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot was presiding over the 15th convocation of Karnataka Veterinary, Animal and Fisheries Sciences University in Bidar

title: Forest department turns to fishermen to rescue Dugongs trapped in fishing gear
content: Nine Dugongs were rescued near Pudukottai coast in the last one year; Forest department has been using a drone to monitor Dugongs besides carrying out daily boat patrolling

title: Institutions under Cooperation Department draw criticism for impeding CAG audit
content: CAG notes that all through the course of SSCA,  audit encountered persistent non-production of essential records/critical information by the audited institutions at all levels

title: Never claimed I was ill while resigning, says former V-P Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: The former V-P stressed that he was only ‚Äúgiving priority‚Äù to his health when he quit in the middle of his term on July 21, 2025; he spoke while on a ‚Äúpersonal visit‚Äù to a Congress MP‚Äôs home in Rajasthan

title: Ambedkar dedicated himself to the quest for justice, says scholar
content: He was of the view that discrimination within the caste system is not accidental but constructed, says Rajeev Bhargava of Parekh Institute of Indian Thought

title: TDP complains to CID against ‚Äòdefamatory‚Äô social media post on Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The party accuses the YSR Congress Party of orchestrating a malicious campaign to tarnish the Chief Minister‚Äôs image, and seeks strict action against those responsible

title: 'Did Robert Vadra, Rahul go to jail?' Kejriwal hits back as Congress questions HC relief
content: In a strongly worded ruling, Special Judge (PC Act) Jitender Singh of the Rouse Avenue Court said the prosecution‚Äôs case was "legally infirm, unsustainable, and unfit to proceed any further in law". The court further observed that when the material collected by the agency was tested on admissibility, relevance and probative value, "the appearance of a coherent conspiracy dissolves," exposing the allegations as being founded on inadmissible material and post-facto reconstruction.

title: 'Shotgun wedding': Teenage lovers skip exam to marry at temple; cops thwart plan
content: A teenage couple in Varanasi, aiming to marry instead of taking their UP Board exams, were intercepted by police. Officers responsibly escorted the students to their respective exam centers first. Post-examination, the 17-year-old girl was taken to the child welfare committee, and both were later permitted to return home after age verification.

title: Decoding 7.8% GDP growth: What it means for India's road to become 3rd largest economy
content: What does the GDP data tell you about the Indian economy? When will India become the third largest economy? What‚Äôs changed in the new GDP series and why is it important? We take a look:

title: Tesla's Former AI Director, who feels behind as programmer, warns software engineers again
content: Programming has undergone a seismic shift, according to former Tesla AI director Andrej Karpathy. He claims coding agents, virtually non-existent before December, now perform complex tasks like setting up a video dashboard in minutes. This marks a departure from traditional coding, with programmers now directing AI agents rather than writing line-by-line code.

title: Film director abducted, assaulted in Karnataka; actor Aishwarya among 11 arrested
content: A film director was abducted and assaulted in Bengaluru over a financial dispute concerning an under-production Kannada movie. Eleven individuals have been arrested in connection with the incident, which involved the director being robbed of gold ornaments and cash. The motive appears to stem from outstanding payments and a disagreement over film investments.

title: Block lays off 40% staff after CEO Jack Dorsey calls layoffs 'destructive to morale'
content: Block, led by CEO Jack Dorsey, has drastically cut its workforce by nearly half, impacting over 4,000 employees. Dorsey cited a shift towards leaner, AI-driven operations as the reason, preferring a single, decisive layoff to avoid prolonged uncertainty and morale damage. Generous severance packages are being offered to departing staff.

title: Area 51: The truth about UFOs, Aliens in America‚Äôs most mysterious military site
content: Recent remarks by President Trump about releasing UFO files have reignited interest in Area 51, a secretive US military site in Nevada. Established in 1955 for classified aircraft testing, its existence was officially acknowledged in 2013. While the government attributes UFO sightings to advanced aircraft testing, public speculation about aliens persists.

title: Sourav Ganguly's message to India selectors: Take Auqib Nabi to England
content: Sourav Ganguly has backed Jammu and Kashmir pacer Auqib Nabi for national selection following his stellar Ranji Trophy final performance. Nabi's five-wicket haul and league-leading 60 wickets this season have earned him praise, with Ganguly suggesting a call-up for the 2026 England white-ball tour.

title: OpenAI, Microsoft release joint statement on their deal: What the two AI companies said
content: Microsoft and OpenAI reaffirm their strong partnership despite new investments from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank.  Their October 2025 agreement remains unchanged, ensuring Microsoft retains exclusive IP licensing and Azure as the sole cloud provider for stateless APIs. This pact allows both entities to pursue independent ventures while continuing their collaborative AI advancement.

title: Full text of Delhi court order: Kejriwal and Sisodia discharged in excise policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case, citing insufficient evidence. The court found no criminal intent or conspiracy substantiated by the chargesheet and supporting documents.  The prosecution failed to establish a larger criminal conspiracy, leading to the discharge of 23 individuals.

title: Karan Johar on Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs deep involvement in KKR
content: Karan Johar highlights Bollywood actors' increasing involvement in business ventures beyond films. He cites Shah Rukh Khan's deep engagement with his IPL team, KKR, as a prime example of a successful, hands-on partnership. Johar also mentions Alia Bhatt and Katrina Kaif's active roles in their respective brands, emphasizing genuine commitment over mere celebrity endorsement.

title: Matthew Tkachuk calls Connor McDavid the best player in the world
content: Florida Panthers forward Matthew Tkachuk called Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid the best player in the world after their Olympic gold medal showdown at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Games. Tkachuk reflected on a pivotal breakaway save by United States goaltender Connor Hellebuyck that preserved Team USA‚Äôs lead and shifted momentum in the championship game.

title: Did Arsenal FC get easiest route in UEFA Champions League last-16 draw?
content: The top football clubs Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City, Tottenham and Newcastle now know their path in the UEFA Champions League knockout stage. The last-16 draw recently took place in Nyon, Switzerland, after eight more teams advanced through the play-offs earlier this week.  Europe‚Äôs biggest clubs are dreaming of glory, but many fans believe Arsenal may have received the most favourable route to the UEFA Champions League final in Budapest.

title: Ekman-Larsson‚Äôs future uncertain amid Toronto Maple Leafs trade talk
content: As the NHL trade deadline gets closer, people are wondering what will happen to Oliver Ekman-Larsson and the Toronto Maple Leafs. There has been a lot of talk about the veteran defenseman moving, but he reportedly wants to stay in Toronto and try to win a Stanley Cup. His ability to produce, lead, and win championships in the past makes him a valuable player, which puts management in a tough spot during this important time.

title: What is COBOL, high-level programming language behind IBM's 'biggest' stock value fall
content: AI startup Anthropic's claim of automating COBOL modernization sent IBM's stock plummeting, wiping billions off its market value. The decades-old language, still powering critical systems, faces a modernization challenge. Anthropic's tool promises to drastically reduce the time and cost of translating COBOL to modern languages, threatening IBM's mainframe business model.

title: 'This should be the rule everywhere': See what happened when a tourist threw orange peels on the roads of Sikkim
content: A tourist's act of littering orange peels in Sikkim led to the intervention of authorities, making him clean his mess. This incident went viral, emphasizing Sikkim's commitment to cleanliness and civic sense. The event sparked discussions across India about responsible behavior and the need for accountability in maintaining public spaces.

title: OPS Joins DMK: Former Tamil Nadu CM switches sides before polls - what does it mean?
content: Former Tamil Nadu CM O. Panneerselvam and his son have joined the DMK, significantly altering the state's political landscape ahead of assembly elections. This move follows his expulsion from the AIADMK after a leadership dispute with E. Palaniswami and a period of political maneuvering.

title: Anthem blunder in Colombo! NZ players left laughing - Watch
content: An interesting moment occurred before the England-New Zealand clash in Colombo when New Zealand‚Äôs national anthem played in fast forward, leaving players laughing. New Zealand won the toss and chose to bat, keeping the same XI, while England brought in Rehan Ahmed. England are already in the semifinals, while New Zealand must win to qualify.

title: Kerala high court stay lifted: Bench allows 'The Kerala Story 2' release
content: The Kerala High Court has lifted a temporary ban on the film 'The Kerala Story 2'. A Division Bench stayed an earlier order that had stalled the movie's release for 15 days. The court had previously asked the CBFC to re-watch and reassess the film's certification due to allegations of promoting hatred.

title: Labour Pain: Why Green win is UK bypolls is a major red flag of Keir Starmer
content: The numbers alone capture the scale of Labour‚Äôs collapse. The Greens secured 14,980 votes, representing 40.7 percent of the electorate. Reform UK came second with 10,578 votes, or 28.7 percent. Labour was pushed into third place with just 9,364 votes, amounting to 25.4 percent. The Conservatives, once Labour‚Äôs primary rival, were reduced to a marginal presence with only 1,721 votes, or 4.7 percent. Turnout stood at 47.6 percent, indicating a serious electoral contest rather than a fringe protest. What had been a Labour majority exceeding 13,000 votes at the last general election was erased within a single parliamentary term.

title: Shirtless protest case: Delhi court grants interim bail to Congress youth wing worker
content: A Delhi court granted interim bail until March 24 to Indian Youth Congress general secretary Nigam Bhandhari in connection with the AI event protest. Bhandhari, who sought anticipatory bail, must cooperate with the ongoing investigation. The protest involved IYC workers revealing T-shirts with anti-PM slogans during the AI Summit. According to police, the protest was planned with a ‚Äúcommon intention".

title: Dropped catches hurt India as Aus win 2nd ODI, take 6-4 lead in all-format series
content: Australia Women secured a commanding five-wicket victory over India Women, clinching the ODI series 2-0. Georgia Voll's century and Phoebe Litchfield's brisk 80 laid the foundation for the successful chase after India posted 251/9. This win extends Australia's all-format series lead, leaving India with much to ponder.

title: Excise case: CBI moves Delhi HC to challenge lower court order discharging Kejriwal
content: The case originated from allegations surrounding the now-withdrawn Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 introduced by the Aam Aadmi Party government. The CBI had alleged that the policy framework was tailored to benefit certain private players through reduced licence fees and predetermined profit margins, resulting in kickbacks and financial losses to the Delhi government.

title: New GDP series: When will India become the fourth largest economy? CEA explains
content: Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran has expressed confidence of above 7% GDP growth potential of the economy. India is on path to become the world‚Äôs third largest economy by the end of this decade - third only to the US and China.

title: India‚Äôs GDP grows at 7.8% in Q3 FY2025-26: Top highlights from first data under new series
content: India‚Äôs economy grew at 7.8% in the October‚ÄìDecember quarter of 2025-26, compared with 7.4% in the corresponding period a year earlier, according to the revised national accounts series.

title: 'Yuvraj is his mentor': Ashwin shushes Amir over 'slogger' remark
content: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Abhishek Sharma after Mohammad Amir called him ‚Äújust a slogger‚Äù following three ducks in the T20 World Cup. Abhishek silenced critics with a quick 55 off 30 balls against Zimbabwe. Ashwin praised his bat swing and rejected the label, while Abhishek said he had waited for this moment and appreciated the team‚Äôs support.

title: US military shoots down govt drone in Texas, leading to flight disruption
content: In a joint statement, the Pentagon, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and CBP confirmed that the military used a "counter-unmanned aircraft system ... to mitigate a seemingly threatening unmanned aerial system operating within military airspace." The agencies added that the episode "took place far away from populated areas and there were no commercial aircraft in the vicinity.

title: Afghanistan vs Pakistan: How the two militaries compare amid ‚Äòopen war‚Äô declaration
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan are locked in an escalating conflict following cross-border strikes. Pakistan's defence minister declared an "open war," citing the worst escalation since October. The military disparity is stark: Pakistan boasts a significantly larger, better-equipped force with advanced air power and a nuclear arsenal, while Afghanistan's capabilities have declined, highlighting a vast imbalance in manpower, firepower, and defence spending.

title: 'May you find strength ... ': Kohli's emotional note after demise of Rinku's father
content: Rinku Singh's father breathed his last on Friday morning at the Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida, informed the hospital PRO. He was undergoing treatment at Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida,.

title: Watch: Strong earthquake rattles Kolkata, residents flee homes, offices in panic
content: Strong tremors, estimated at magnitude 5.4, shook Kolkata on Friday afternoon, causing panic and prompting residents to evacuate homes and offices. The earthquake's epicenter was located just 3 km inside Bangladesh, near the India-Bangladesh border, with tremors felt across the city and surrounding areas.

title: 'No overarching conspiracy or criminal intent': Why court cleared Kejriwal, Sisodia in excise case
content: Delhi excise policy case: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and 21 others in the excise policy case, citing a lack of cogent evidence and no prima facie case. The judge found no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent in the policy's formulation, criticising the CBI's investigative approach and reliance on approver statements.

title: Domestic help carries out 'fake ED raid' at retired employer's house
content: A domestic help orchestrated a fake Enforcement Directorate raid on her elderly employer's home in Delhi, enlisting relatives and associates. The plan unraveled when the victim's grandson, an ED lawyer, confronted the imposters by phone, leading to their escape with a portion of the stolen cash. The maid and her sister-in-law have been arrested.

title: Modi, Amit Shah hatched biggest conspiracy of independent India to crush AAP: Kejriwal
content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal hailed his discharge in the CBI's excise policy case as a "triumph of truth," calling the investigation a politically motivated conspiracy to dismantle the AAP. He asserted his honesty and accused Prime Minister Modi and Home Minister Shah of orchestrating a "fabricated" case to jail top party leaders.

title: Stock market down: Nifty50 below 25,200, Sensex crashes over 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex crashed in trade on Friday on weak global cues and persistent FII selling. While Nifty50 went below 25,200, BSE Sensex dropped over 1,000 points.

title: 45% drop in Indians at US universities over visa uncertainty, high cost
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage‚Äîboth reflective and news-driven‚Äîadds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. title: 'Sorry': Giants' Harrison Bader autographs food truck dented by spring training home run

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Bracketology: Florida rejoins the 2-seed line

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, over/under bet for each team
content: the 2026 Olympic ice hockey tournament is complete . all players have returned to their teams, some to the ice, others to injured reserve . a new 1-32 poll is based on the games through Wednesday . it's time to take the temperature with another set of Power Rankings .

title: Wetzel: In search of NFL's fact-finding mission on Giants owner Tisch
content: it has been four weeks since the release of emails between sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and new york Giants co-owner Steve Tisch . the league will look at all the facts to determine whether a full investigation was in order for potential violations of the league's personal conduct policy . "Absolutely we'll look at the context of those [emails] and try to understand that," Goodell said .

title: Does anyone beat Ohtani? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 designated hitters
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at designated hitters . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career . we rolled out a position per day over two weeks .

title: 25 surprising stars: Tyler Tanner, Ebuka Okorie, more breakouts
content: the 2025-26 men's college basketball season has been defined by the stars who have turned it into one of the most exciting for the sport in recent memory . the freshman class has an abundance of talent, and there are transfers who have transformed programs, with multiple from either category emerging as household names . we've identified 25 breakout stars to know -- players who have bounced back from injuries .

title: An Ivy League All-American? The next Theo Epstein? Why an ace chose Yale over the SEC
content: OHman was a freshman navigating his first collegiate baseball season . the 6-foot right-hander barely pitched in high school . he admits he considered leaving the Ivy League for a power 4 school, but who would blame him .

title: NFLPA 2026 report cards: See the results for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: How the top QB signings will fit in 2026
content: the top 2026 recruits at each position could fit at their new schools . the perfect harmony between skill and scheme can lead to production and wins on the field . this is the most high-profile prospect Houston has signed in the modern era .

title: Preview for the 2026 PLL, WLL Championship Series: Key players, schedule, predictions
content: the 2026 PLL and WLL Championship Series runs from Feb. 27 to March 8 . the event uses the Sixes format, which will be used when lacrosse returns to the Olympics in 2028 . it has key differences from outdoor "field" lacross and indoor "box" la crosse .

title: Who wins People's Pusk√°s Award for world's best amateur goal of the year?
content: the people's Pusk√°s Award is dedicated to singling out the most beautiful goal scored by professional players . the award has given a platform to the very best goals scored at the grassroots and junior levels of the game .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .
